intent: Enable safe, opt-in partial acceptance of a delta: admit good change-slices, reject bad ones, and emit receipts that record exactly what was applied vs rejected. This supports delta archaeology (salvage gold, quarantine junk).

details.rule: A delta may be partially admitted ONLY if it declares slice_policy='ALLOW_PARTIAL'. Otherwise deltas remain atomic.
When slice_policy='ALLOW_PARTIAL', every changes[i] MUST include: change_id, touched_modules/applies_to, validation, rollback.
details.why: Prevents half-applied dependencies and keeps rollback unambiguous.

details.rule: DeltaGate evaluates each change as its own unit: DG-1..DG-5 + score. Overall delta decision becomes a vector: ACCEPTED[], REJECTED[], HOLD[].

details.invariant: No silent partial apply; receipts must be generated and referenced by mb:deltas.

details.mb:deltas: Show slice_policy plus accepted/rejected/hold counts (when sliceable).
details.mb:apply-delta: If sliceable: returns BAM for accepted slices + references slice receipt; explains rejected slices in 1â€“3 bullets.

details.rule: A change slice may declare depends_on:[change_id,...]. If any dependency is rejected/hold, dependent slice cannot be accepted.
details.note: Keeps partial admission safe when deltas bundle linked edits.

self_check: Non-destructive: creates receipts only; does not mutate packs.
Deterministic: slice receipts include per-change sha-like fingerprints and reasons.

expected_behavior.atomic_default: Existing deltas without slice_policy remain all-or-nothing.
expected_behavior.sliceable_delta: When slice_policy='ALLOW_PARTIAL', DeltaGate produces slice receipt with accepted/rejected/hold lists.

how: Remove this DELTA from Project Files to disable partial admission and revert to atomic deltas only.
Slice receipts are evidence artifacts; deleting them is optional and does not affect authority.
